qas.question: Distinctive Vinaya and ethics are contained within what sutra?
Bodhisattvas are not encouraged to eat what?
Where is the monastic vinaya displaced and clergy is allowed to marry?

context: In Eastern Buddhism, there is also a distinctive Vinaya and ethics contained within the <a0_0>Mahayana Brahmajala<a0_0/> Sutra (not to be confused with the Pali text of that name) for Bodhisattvas, where, for example, the eating of <a1_0>meat<a1_0/> is frowned upon and vegetarianism is actively encouraged (see vegetarianism in Buddhism). In <a2_0>Japan<a2_0/>, this has almost completely displaced the monastic vinaya, and allows clergy to marry.
